_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: All Other Basic Inorganic Chemical Manufacturing

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The II-VI Incorporated facilities in Saxonburg, PA produce optical and opto-electronic components, devices and materials for infrared, near-infrared, visible light, x-ray and gamma-ray instrumentation and telecommunication applications.

Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies at the Stationary Source (? 68.155(a))

II-VI Incorporated has established a system for the safe operation of the processes that includes the prevention of accidental releases of hazardous substances.  One component of this system is a program to manage the risks of accidental releases.  This program conforms to the requirements of the Environmental Protection Agency's (EPA's) regulation 40 CFR part 68, Accidental Release Prevention Requirement Risk Management Programs (the RMP rule) and requirements of OSHA 1910.119.  This document is intended to satisfy the RMP plan requirement of the RMP rule and to provide the public with a description of the risk management program at the II-VI Saxonburg facilities.

The Stationary Source and Regulated Substances Handled (? 68.155(b))

The II-VI Saxonburg facilities include several materials production plants.  One materials production plant handles one substance that is regulated by the RMP rule.  This substance is hydrogen selenide.
 
The General Accidental Release Prevention Program and Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps (? 68.155(c))

The II-VI Saxonburg facility's prevention program has been prepared so that it conforms to both the OSHA Process Safety Management and the EPA Risk Management Plan regulations.  The program consists of the following elements:

* Process Safety Information
* Process Hazard Analysis
* Operating Procedures
* Training
* Mechanical Integrity
* Management of Change
* Pre-Startup Review
* Compliance Audits
* Incident Investigation
* Employee Participation
* Procedures
* Contractor Safety

The prevention program is documented and maintained at the facility.  It is updated when necessary.

Five-year Accident

History (? 68.155(d))

There have not been any RMP accidents at this facility in the past 5 years.

Emergency Response Program (? 68.155(e))

The II-VI Saxonburg facility has established a written emergency response plan and maintains an emergency response team trained in these emergency response procedures.  An on-site community emergency warning system is an integral part of the emergency response procedures.   

The facility is a member of the Butler County Local Emergency Planning Committee, which includes industrial and public entities.

Planned Changes to Improve Safety (? 68.155(f))

The II-VI Saxonburg facility has a policy of continuous improvement.  In support of that policy, we constantly improve the safety of the processes with reviews of our plant processes and procedures, an incident investigation program, and an employee Environmental, Health and Safety Committee.
